intro: Hieracium lilacinum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually purple or lilac in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium lilacinum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
